## Overview

Whether they are configured for cloud distribution, file synchronization, or something else, storage containers are primarily used for sharing documents.  For more private, instance-only storage, one should likely be leveraging persistent volumes, or IOPS will suffer as the network overhead of Storage Containers is seldom appropriate for unshared content.

### Remediation

If the storage container is intended to be secure to the degree that it contains no permissions, it may be appropriate to tag the storage container in accordance to your tagging policies so that it can be excluded from this insight.  Otherwise, it may represent an unnecessary expenditure, and may be terminable.

### Recommended Bot Workflow

- Assign Tag to Resource: Enforce tagging policy by applying a tag to the storage container that exempts it from this insight.
- Scheduled Deletion: After giving enough time for investigation, schedule the storage container to be deleted.
